<title level="1" right="Hazard 21" pfs="">[Cuastic Shower](/Hazards.aspx?ID=329)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Mechanical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=105" />
<trait label="Trap" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=158" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #186: Ghost King's Rage](/Sources.aspx?ID=189) pg. 63</row>

**Complexity** Simple

</column>

Contact with the doors, pillars, or statue causes a shower of acid.

---

**Stealth**
DC 53 (legendary)

**Disable**
DC 48 [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4) (master) to ground the charged features or DC 50 [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=17) (legendary) to disable the contact sensors

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

**Acid Shower** <actions string="Reaction" /> ([acid](/Traits.aspx?ID=3)) **Trigger** A creature touches the doors, pillars, or statue directly or with a tool; **Effect** A shower of acid rains down from the ceiling, dealing 8d10+48 acid damage to all creatures in the chamber (DC 44 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). On a critical failure, a creature additionally takes 1d10 [persistent acid damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29).
